meanings.sent1: The coarse sandpaper scratched my skin.
meanings.sent2: The coarse fabric of the burlap sack was uncomfortable against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The coarse towel felt like sandpaper after it was left out in the sun too long.
meanings.sent4: His coarse hands felt like they were made of rough stone.
meanings.sent5: The coarse gravel crunched loudly under our feet as we walked.

meanings.sent1: Her coarse manners at the dinner table shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The coarse painting lacked the intricate details of the artist's other works.
meanings.sent3: His coarse jokes made the whole room uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The coarse language used in the argument left a bitter taste in the air.
meanings.sent5: The coarse stitching on the pillow gave it a homemade, rustic feel.

meanings.definition: Indecent or vulgar in language or behavior
meanings.sent1: The comedian's coarse jokes offended many in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The coarse language used by the group of teenagers was inappropriate for the setting.
meanings.sent3: She regretted her coarse comment as soon as it left her mouth.
meanings.sent4: The coarse behavior of the guests at the party was unacceptable.
meanings.sent5: The coarse graffiti on the wall was a blight on the neighborhood.
